American Express Credit Cards

Written by: Tracy Stewart | Edited by: Jeanine Skowronski | Reviewed by: Stephanie Zito
|

September 5, 2024

Known for outstanding customer service and major rewards, our partner American Express offers some of the best credit cards around for people with good or excellent credit. Whether you’re looking to earn cash back or get rewards for travel or your business, there’s an Amex card for you.

Known for outstanding customer service and major rewards, our partner American Express offers some of the best credit cards around for people with good or excellent credit. Whether you’re looking to earn cash back or get rewards for travel or your business, there’s an Amex card for you.

How we Choose

Our editorial team and expert review board provide an unbiased analysis of the products we feature. Our comparison service is compensated by our credit card company partners, and may influence where or how products are featured on the site. This site does not include all credit card companies or all available credit card offers.  Please note: The star-rating system on this page is based on our independent card scoring methodology and is not influenced by advertisers or card issuers.Learn more about our partners and how we make money.

Best American Express credit cards of 2024:

  • The Platinum Card from American Express: Best for luxury travel perks
  • American Express Gold Card: Best for dining rewards
  • Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express: Best for no annual fee
  • Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express: Best for high cash back rates
  • American Express Business Gold Card: Best for small business travel
  • The Business Platinum Card from American Express: Best for luxury business travel perks
  • Delta SkyMiles Gold Business American Express Card: Best for Delta-loyal small business owners
  • Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card: Best for Hilton hotel stays
  • Delta SkyMiles Platinum Business American Express Card: Best for business travelers seeking elevated status
  • The American Express Blue Business CashTM Card: Best for cash back rewards for business
  • American Express Green Card Best for everyday travel

Why we like this card

If youre a frequent traveler looking for top drawer perks, trip protections, and valuable credits, The Platinum Card from American Express is a strong choice. The $695 annual fee is high but jetsetters will have no trouble recouping that in a few trips. Cardmembers earn 5X points on flights booked directly with airlines or through American Express Travel (up to $500,000 on these purchases per calendar year), as well as 5X points on eligible hotels booked through American Express Travel. All other eligible purchases earn 1X points.

Read the full review

Pros

  • This card includes perks such as lounge access, a statement credit for Global Entry or TSA Precheck, Uber Cash credit annually (on U.S. rides and eats), up to a $199 CLEAR Plus annual credit for your membership, Hilton Honors gold status (enrollment required) and Uber VIP status.
  • There are no blackout dates.

Cons

  • Travel rewards must be redeemed through American Express Travel.
  • If you dont travel often, you may be better served by a card with a lower annual fee.

Bottom Line

Eager travelers will find a lot of value in this luxury travel card, from its long list of perks, credits, and travel protections to its decent rewards rate and welcome bonus.

Highlights

  • Earn 80,000 Membership Rewards Points after you spend $8,000 on eligible purchases on your new Card in your first 6 months of Card Membership. Apply and select your preferred metal Card design: classic Platinum, Platinum x Kehinde Wiley, or Platinum x Julie Mehretu.
  • Earn 5X Membership Rewards Points for flights booked directly with airlines or with American Express Travel up to $500,000 on these purchases per calendar year and earn 5X Membership Rewards Points on prepaid hotels booked with American Express Travel.
  • $200 Hotel Credit: Get up to $200 back in statement credits each year on prepaid Fine Hotels + Resorts or The Hotel Collection bookings through American Express Travel using your Platinum Card. The Hotel Collection requires a minimum two-night stay.
  • $240 Digital Entertainment Credit: Get up to $20 back in statement credits each month on eligible purchases made with your Platinum Card on one or more of the following: Disney+, a Disney Bundle, ESPN+, Hulu, The New York Times, Peacock, and The Wall Street Journal. Enrollment required.
  • The American Express Global Lounge Collection can provide an escape at the airport. With complimentary access to more than 1,400 airport lounges across 140 countries and counting, you have more airport lounge options than any other credit card issuer on the market. As of 03/2023.
  • $155 Walmart+ Credit: Save on eligible delivery fees, shipping, and more with a Walmart+ membership. Use your Platinum Card to pay for a monthly Walmart+ membership and get up to $12.95 plus applicable taxes back on one membership (excluding Plus Ups) each month.
  • $200 Airline Fee Credit: Select one qualifying airline and then receive up to $200 in statement credits per calendar year when incidental fees are charged by the airline to your Platinum Card.
  • $200 Uber Cash: Enjoy Uber VIP status and up to $200 in Uber savings on rides or eats orders in the US annually. Uber Cash and Uber VIP status is available to Basic Card Member only. Terms Apply.
  • $199 CLEAR Plus Credit: CLEAR Plus helps to get you to your gate faster at 50+ airports nationwide and get up to $199 back per calendar year on your Membership (subject to auto-renewal) when you use your Card. CLEARLanes are available at 100+ airports, stadiums, and entertainment venues.
  • Receive either a $100 statement credit every 4 years for a Global Entry application fee or a statement credit up to $85 every 4.5 years for a TSA PreCheck (through a TSA official enrollment provider) application fee, when charged to your Platinum Card. Card Members approved for Global Entry will also receive access to TSA PreCheck at no additional cost.
  • Shop Saks with Platinum: Get up to $100 in statement credits annually for purchases in Saks Fifth Avenue stores or at saks.com on your Platinum Card. That's up to $50 in statement credits semi-annually. Enrollment required.
  • Unlock access to exclusive reservations and special dining experiences with Global Dining Access by Resy when you add your Platinum Card to your Resy profile.
  • $695 annual fee.
  • Terms Apply.

Why we like this card

The American Express Gold Card offers excellent reward rates across a range of categories, making it easy to earn rewards. Cardmembers earn 3X points on flights booked directly with airlines or through AmexTravel.com, 4X points at restaurants worldwide on up to $50,000 in purchases per calendar year (then 1x), and 4X points at U.S. supermarkets on up to $25,000 in purchases per calendar year (then 1X). The card also includes a decent introductory offer of 60,000 points after spending $6,000 in the first six months of account opening. Plus, receive 20% back in statement credits on eligible purchases made at restaurants worldwide within the first 6 months of Card Membership, up to $100 back (limited time offer ends 11/6/24). Theres also a fair amount of annual food related perks including a generous dining credit (enrollment required).

Read the full review

Pros

  • There are no foreign transaction fees.
  • There are a lot of airline transfer partners, including Delta.

Cons

  • The annual fee of $325 may be more than some are willing to spend.
  • Many of this cards credits carry caveats that can make them a bit confusing to capitalize on.

Bottom Line

This is a well-rounded card with a high rewards rate in multiple categories. Frequent travelers, in particular, will find value in its travel credits, while foodies will appreciate the generous dining credits.

Highlights

  • Earn 60,000 Membership Rewards Points after you spend $6,000 on eligible purchases on your new Card in your first 6 months of Card Membership. Plus, receive 20% back in statement credits on eligible purchases made at restaurants worldwide within the first 6 months of Card Membership, up to $100 back. Limited time offer. Offer ends 11/6/24.
  • Get the American Express Gold Card in either the Gold, Rose Gold or Limited-Edition White Gold metal design. White Gold design is only available while supplies last.
  • Earn 4X Membership Rewards points per dollar spent on purchases at restaurants worldwide, on up to $50,000 in purchases per calendar year, then 1X points for the rest of the year.
  • Earn 4X Membership Rewards points per dollar spent at US supermarkets, on up to $25,000 in purchases per calendar year, then 1X points for the rest of the year.
  • Earn 3X Membership Rewards points per dollar spent on flights booked directly with airlines or on AmexTravel.com.
  • Earn 2X Membership Rewards points per dollar spent on prepaid hotels and other eligible purchases booked on AmexTravel.com.
  • Earn 1X Membership Rewards point per dollar spent on all other eligible purchases.
  • $120 Uber Cash on Gold: Add your Gold Card to your Uber account and each month automatically get $10 in Uber Cash for Uber Eats orders or Uber rides in the U.S., totaling up to $120 per year.
  • $84 Dunkin' Credit: With the $84 Dunkin' Credit, you can earn up to $7 in monthly statement credits after you enroll and pay with the American Express Gold Card at Dunkin' locations.
  • $100 Resy Credit: Get up to $100 in statement credits each calendar year after you pay with the American Express Gold Card to dine at U.S. Resy restaurants or make other eligible Resy purchases. That's up to $50 in statement credits semi-annually. Enrollment required.
  • $120 Dining Credit: Satisfy your cravings, sweet or savory, with the $120 Dining Credit. Earn up to $10 in statement credits monthly when you pay with the American Express Gold Card at Grubhub, The Cheesecake Factory, Goldbelly, Wine.com, and Five Guys. Enrollment required.
  • Explore over 1,000 upscale hotels worldwide with The Hotel Collection and receive a $100 credit towards eligible charges with every booking of two nights or more through AmexTravel.com. Eligible charges vary by property.
  • No Foreign Transaction Fees.
  • Annual Fee is $325.
  • Terms Apply.

Why we like this card

The Blue Cash Everyday Card offers excellent cash back at U.S. supermarkets, U.S. gas stations and on U.S. online retail purchases, but with no annual fee. For daily commuters and households with big grocery bills, these high reward rates could quickly pay off.

Read the full review

Pros

  • Cardholders can earn a $200 statement credit after you spend $2,000 in purchases within the first six months.
  • There are no rotating categories or enrollments to keep track of.

Cons

  • Rewards cannot be transferred or combined with other cards.
  • The 3% cash back rate is capped at $6,000 in purchases annually in each category then drops to 1%.

Bottom Line

For big households and road warriors, these featured rewards categories make everyday purchases especially valuable. Also noteworthy: the intro APR on purchases and balance transfers is ideal for anyone hoping to finance a large purchase or pay off some debt.

Highlights

  • Earn a $200 statement credit after you spend $2,000 in purchases on your new Card within the first 6 months.
  • No Annual Fee.
  • Enjoy 0% intro APR on purchases and balance transfers for 15 months from the date of account opening. After that, 19.24% to 29.99% variable APR.
  • 3% Cash Back at U.S. supermarkets on up to $6,000 per year in purchases, then 1%.
  • 3% Cash Back on U.S. online retail purchases, on up to $6,000 per year, then 1%.
  • 3% Cash Back at U.S. gas stations, on up to $6,000 per year, then 1%.
  • Cash back is received in the form of Reward Dollars that can be redeemed as a statement credit or at Amazon.com checkout.
  • Thinking about getting the Disney Bundle which can include Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+? Your decision made easy with $7/month back in the form of a statement credit after you spend $9.99 or more each month on an eligible subscription (subject to auto renewal) with your Blue Cash Everyday Card. Enrollment required.
  • Enjoy up to $15 back per month when you purchase a Home Chef meal kit subscription (subject to auto renewal) with your enrolled Blue Cash Everyday Card.
  • Terms Apply.

Why we like this card

Earn a whopping 6% cash back at U.S. supermarkets (up to $6,000 in purchases per year, then 1%) as well as on select U.S. streaming subscriptions, plus earn 3% cash back at U.S. gas stations and public transit. General purchases earn 1% cash back. As if that werent enough, you earn a $250 statement credit after you spend $3,000 in eligible purchases within the first six months.

Read the full review

Pros

  • Rewards can be redeemed for previous purchases.
  • Theres no enrollment required and no rotating categories to keep track of.

Cons

  • The 6% bonus at U.S. supermarkets is excellent, but its capped to $6,000 in annual purchases, then 1%.
  • In addition, the 3% and 6% rewards are only applicable to U.S. purchases.

Bottom Line

Any household that spends a considerable amount of its monthly budget on groceries, gas or transit will appreciate the high rewards rate offered by the Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express. Yes, theres an ongoing $95 annual fee ($0 intro annual fee for the first year) though its easily recouped after a few trips to the supermarket.

Highlights

  • Earn a $250 statement credit after you spend $3,000 in eligible purchases on your new Card within the first 6 months.
  • $0 intro annual fee for the first year, then $95.
  • Buy Now, Pay Later: Enjoy $0 intro plan fees when you use Plan It to split up large purchases into monthly installments. Pay $0 intro plan fees on plans created during the first 12 months from the date of account opening. Plans created after that will have a monthly plan fee up to 1.33% of each eligible purchase amount moved into a plan based on the plan duration, the APR that would otherwise apply to the purchase, and other factors.
  • Low Intro APR: 0% on purchases and balance transfers for 12 months from the date of account opening. After that, your APR will be a variable APR of 19.24% - 29.99%.
  • 6% Cash Back at U.S. supermarkets on up to $6,000 per year in purchases (then 1%).
  • 6% Cash Back on select U.S. streaming subscriptions.
  • 3% Cash Back at U.S. gas stations.
  • 3% Cash Back on transit (including taxis/rideshare, parking, tolls, trains, buses and more).
  • 1% Cash Back on other purchases.
  • Cash Back is received in the form of Reward Dollars that can be redeemed as a statement credit or at Amazon.com checkout.
  • $84 Disney Bundle Credit: With your enrolled Blue Cash Preferred Card, spend $9.99 or more each month on an auto-renewing Disney Bundle subscription, to receive a monthly statement credit of $7. Valid only at Disney Plus.com, Hulu.com or Plus.espn.com in the U.S.
  • Terms Apply.

Why we like this card

As an introductory bonus, small business owners earn 100,000 points after spending $15,000 on eligible purchases within the first three months of card membership. Plus, earn 4X points on your top two eligible spending categories where your business spends the most each billing cycle (out of six eligible categories), up to $150,000 in purchases annually, then 1X.

Read the full review

Pros

  • There are no blackout dates.
  • Points can be transferred to 16 partner airlines.

Cons

  • If youre hoping to redeem for anything beyond travel, you may be underwhelmed by redemption options.
  • The annual fee is much higher than cards with similar offers.

Bottom Line

The travel protections and frills offered by this card are a good fit for small business owners who are frequently on the road.

Highlights

  • Welcome Offer: Earn 100,000 Membership Rewards points after you spend $15,000 on eligible purchases with the Business Gold Card within the first 3 months of Card Membership.*
  • 0% Intro APR for 6 months from the date of account opening on purchases eligible for Pay Over Time, then a 19.49% to 28.49% variable APR.*
  • Earn 4X Membership Rewards points on the top two eligible categories where your business spends the most each month from 6 eligible categories. While your top 2 categories may change, you will earn 4X points on the first $150,000 in combined purchases from these categories each calendar year (then 1X thereafter). Only the top 2 categories each billing cycle will count towards the $150,000 cap.*
  • Earn 3X Membership Rewards points on flights and prepaid hotels booked on amextravel.com using your Business Gold Card.*
  • Earn up to $20 in statement credits monthly after you use the Business Gold Card for eligible U.S. purchases at FedEx, Grubhub, and Office Supply Stores. This can be an annual savings of up to $240. Enrollment required.
  • Get up to a $12.95** statement credit back each month after you pay for a monthly Walmart+ membership (subject to auto-renewal) with your Business Gold Card. **Up to $12.95 plus applicable taxes on one membership fee.*
  • The Business Gold Card now comes in three metal designs: Gold, Rose Gold and Limited Edition White Gold. White Gold design is only available while supplies last. Make your selection when you apply on Americanexpress.com.
  • *Terms Apply

As an introductory bonus, new members can earn 10,000 miles after spending $1,000 in the first six months of membership.

Read the full review

Pros

  • Cardmembers enjoy a 20% discount (received as a statement credit) on inflight purchases of food and beverages.
  • There are no blackout dates.

Cons

  • This card doesnt come with a lot of perks that are included with more premium Delta cards, such as priority boarding or complimentary checked bags.
  • Fuel surcharges on international flights can be very expensive.

Bottom Line

For a no-annual-fee card, Delta flyers can earn a decent rewards rate, even on restaurant spending. Still, the lack of Delta perks may put off frequent travelers hoping for more.

Highlights

Editors picks: American Express credit cards

Best for luxury travel perks: The Platinum Card from American Express

  • Best features: One of the best travel credit cards on the market, the Platinum Card offers a bevy of luxury travel benefits, including airport lounge access, a statement credit for Global Entry or TSA PreCheck, an Uber cash credit, up to a $199 CLEAR Plus annual credit for your membership and no foreign transaction fees (see rates and fees).
  • Biggest drawbacks: That laundry list of premium travel benefits come with a $695 annual fee, not waived the first year.
  • Alternative: The Capital One Venture X Rewards Credit Card has a smaller annual fee of $395 and has luxury perks including lounge access. Learn more about the Capital One Venture X vs. Amex Platinum Card.
  • Bottom line: With its first-rate travel perks, The Platinum Card from American Express offers an excellent value for frequent travelers.

Read our Platinum Card from American Express review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for dining rewards: American Express Gold Card

  • Best features: The American Express Gold Card has superb rewards for dining, shopping and traveling. Available in white gold in addition to rose gold and regular gold, it earns 4X points at restaurants (on up to $50,000 in purchases per calendar year, then 1x) and 4X points at U.S. supermarkets (on up to $25,000 in purchases per calendar year, then 1X). Furthermore, it earns 3X points on flights booked directly with airlines or through amextravel.com, making it a well-rounded card.
  • Biggest drawbacks: Theres a $325 annual fee (not waived the first year).
  • Alternative: If your budget cant handle high fees, you can still earn high rewards if youre willing to juggle multiple credit cards. The Capital One SavorOne Cash Rewards Credit Card offers 3% cash back for dining and doesn’t charge an annual fee . Pair it with the Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express ($0 intro annual fee for the first year, then $95), which offers an impressive 6% cash back at U.S. supermarkets (on up to $6,000 in purchases per year, then 1%). Both come with even more rewards-earning opportunities, making it a powerful combination to have in your wallet.
  • Bottom line: Frequent travelers will get the most use of its travel benefits and other opportunities, particularly the 4X and 3X earning categories that make it easy to maximize Membership Rewards points to then turn into trips.

Read our American Express Gold Card review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for no annual fee: Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express

  • Best features: The Blue Cash Everyday is the mini-me of the Blue Cash Preferred, with excellent cash back on groceries and when filling up your car, but with no annual fee. Earn 3% back at U.S. supermarkets, U.S. gas stations and on U.S. online retail purchases on up to $6,000 in purchases per year in each category (then 1%), perfect for the growing family.
  • Biggest drawbacks: The spending cap may be easily topped by families with big grocery budgets.
  • Alternative: Depending on how much you spend, the Blue Cash Preferred from American Express might offer more bang for your buck, despite the $95 annual fee ($0 intro annual fee for the first year). For more information, take a look at when a credit card with an annual fee is worth it.
  • Bottom line: Large families stand to do very well in these featured rewards categories. Plus, the 0% intro APR on purchases and balance transfers for the first 15 months (19.24% to 29.99% variable APR thereafter) is attractive to those who want to make a large purchase or pay off some debt and carry the balance for a bit.

Read our Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for high cash back rates: Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express

  • Best features: We love this cards generous cash back rates. Earn 6% cash back at U.S. supermarkets (up to $6,000 in purchases per year, then 1%); 6% cash back on select U.S. streaming subscriptions and 3% cash back at U.S. gas stations and on transit. It also offers 1% cash back on general purchases.
  • Biggest drawbacks: The 6% bonus at U.S. supermarkets is great, though its capped to $6,000 in purchases per year and 1% thereafter. There is a $95 annual fee ($0 intro annual fee for the first year).
  • Alternative: If you dont get the most value from grocery shopping, the Citi Custom Cash Card lets you decide how you want to earn high rewards, offering 5% cash back on up to $500 spent each billing cycle in your top eligible spending category, then 1%. Learn more about the Citi Custom Cash Card vs. American Express Blue Cash Preferred.
  • Bottom line: The Blue Cash Preferred card offers a high cash back rate on categories that will appeal to big families on the go.

Read our Blue Cash Preferred from American Express review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for small business travel: American Express Business Gold Card

  • Best features: This card offers a decent value to small business owners who stand to earn 100,000 points after spending $15,000 on eligible purchases in the first three months of card membership. Thats in addition to potential bonus rewards in your top two eligible categories each billing cycle such as gas and travel.
  • Biggest drawbacks: There is an annual fee of $375, and if your spending doesnt align with the bonus categories, youll get little value out of this card. Plus, depending on what you decide to do with your rewards, you may lose out on some value. While there are several ways you can use your points, redeeming for travel is consistently the most valuable route.
  • Alternative: Instead of earning 4X points in two eligible business categories each month, the Capital One Spark Miles for Business is a flat-rate credit card that offers an unlimited 2X miles per dollar on every purchase, giving you more freedom to earn rewards on your everyday purchases.
  • Bottom line: Small-business owners who hope to rack up points to put towards travel will appreciate the flexible bonus rewards, lack of foreign transaction fee (see rates and fees), and other travel perks associated with the American Express Business Gold Card.

Read our American Express Business Gold Card review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for luxury business travel perks: The Business Platinum Card from American Express

  • Best features: With a whopper of an introductory offer and excellent travel benefits, the Business Platinum Card from American Express is a solid card for high-spending business owners on the go. Earn up to 150,000 points after spending $20,000 on eligible purchases in the first three months of membership. When booking through Amextravel.com, cardholders earn 2X points per dollar on eligible travel and a 35% bonus on points redeemed through Amextravel.com with your selected qualifying airline (up to 1,000,000 points per calendar year).
  • Biggest drawbacks: The high annual fee of $695 may scare away some business owners.
  • Alternative: The American Express Business Gold Card might be a better fit for small-business travelers who dont need all the luxury bells and whistles and who prefer a card with a smaller annual fee. Read more about the Amex Business Gold vs. Amex Business Platinum.
  • Bottom line: Small-business owners may balk at the high annual fee and the high spend requirement to satisfy the introductory offer, but high-budget, travel-happy businesses fit this card well.

Read our The Business Platinum Card from American Express review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for Delta-loyal small business owners: Delta SkyMiles Gold Business American Express Card

  • Best features: Travelers can earn 55,000 Bonus Miles after spending $4,000 in purchases in your first six months of Card Membership. You can also earn a credit of up to $200 for future Delta flights after spending $10,000 in a calendar year. Earn two miles per dollar on eligible direct Delta purchases, at restaurants and on U.S. purchases for advertising in select media and U.S. shipping purchases (on up to $50,000 in eligible purchases per category, per year), plus one mile per dollar on all other eligible purchases.
  • Biggest drawbacks: Compared to general-purpose travel cards, the redemption options are not as flexible. And if your business doesnt fly Delta regularly, the welcome offer and travel perks will be lost on you.
  • Alternative: For greater flexibility, American Express Business Gold Card is for small-business owners who arent loyal to just one airline.
  • Bottom line: The Delta SkyMiles Gold Business American Express Card is a low-cost travel card best for small businesses located in or around a Delta hub city or people who like Delta as their preferred airline and who frequently spend in categories such as dining, shipping, and advertising.

Read our Delta SkyMiles Gold Business American Express Card review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for Hilton hotel stays: Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card

  • Best features: Cardholders earn 12X points for spending at participating hotels and resorts within the Hilton Portfolio; 6X points on eligible purchases at U.S. restaurants, supermarkets and gas stations; and 3X points on all other eligible purchases.
  • Biggest drawbacks: Theres a big annual spend requirement ($15,000) to earn a free night reward.
  • Alternative: Its hard to beat all the Hilton perks youll get with the Surpass card, but if you arent tied to only one hotel brand, you may get better value out of the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. Points are worth more when you book through Chase Ultimate Rewards and have greater flexibility.
  • Bottom line: The Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card is ideal for the traveler who frequents the Hilton brand. Hilton loyalists can take advantage of elite status and Hiltons expansive network of hotels and resorts around the world.

Read our Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for business travelers seeking elevated status: Delta SkyMiles Platinum Business American Express Card

  • Best features: This high-value travel card earns a welcome offer of 65,000 Bonus Miles after spending $6,000 in purchases on your new card in your first six months of Card Membership.
  • Biggest drawbacks: Theres a $350 annual fee, and free lounge access isnt one of this cards perks.
  • Alternative: Busy travelers who want more flexibility in how they travel and earn rewards should check out the Chase Ink Business Preferred Credit Card. It doesnt come with all the exclusive Delta perks, but for $95 per year and offers 3 points per $1 dollar on the first $150,000 spent in combined travel and select business categories each year.
  • Bottom line: Business owners who want to enjoy elite status and who frequently fly Delta will find a lot of value in this cards wide range of travel perks.

Read our Delta SkyMiles Platinum Business American Express Card review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for cash back rewards for business: The American Express Blue Business Cash Card

  • Best features: With no annual fee, you can quickly rack up cash back for your business with this card. Youll earn 2% cash back on all eligible purchases on up to $50,000 per calendar year, then 1%.
  • Biggest drawbacks: The spending cap on 2% earnings will be a disappointment to businesses who can easily spend more than $50,000 per year.
  • Alternative: The Blue Business Plus Credit Card from American Express has a more complicated rewards program that can provide more value to small-business owners who want to maximize the amount of rewards they earn.
  • Bottom line: Start-ups and small businesses will appreciate the simplicity that this flat-rate rewards card offers.

Read our The American Express Blue Business Cash Card review or jump back to this card’s offer details.

Best for travelers who want elite status: Delta SkyMiles Platinum American Express Card

  • Best features: This card includes an introductory bonus of 50,000 Bonus Miles after you spend $3,000 in purchases in your first six months of Card Membership.
  • Biggest drawbacks: A $350 annual fee and no free lounge access.
  • Alternative: For a lower annual fee, the American Express Gold Card wont get you elite status with Delta. But it offers more flexibility and its own sets of features and benefits that may be more appealing.
  • Bottom line: Frequent travelers and Delta loyalists will be delighted by the long list of travel perks, such as an annual companion certificate, discounts on inflight purchases, priority boarding and more.

Read our Delta SkyMiles Platinum American Express Card review.

Best for airline miles: Delta SkyMiles Gold American Express Card

  • Best features: In addition to Delta, travelers have its large network of airline partners to choose from. Best of all, miles dont expire. Also, within your first six months you can earn 40,000 Bonus Miles after you spend $2,000 in purchases in your first six months of Card Membership.
  • Biggest drawbacks: This card doesnt come with lounge access and wont help you earn Deltas elite status.
  • Alternative: The Capital One Venture Rewards Credit Card carries a slightly smaller $95 annual fee and provides better flexibility for people who are not loyal to Delta. The 5 miles per dollar on hotels, vacation rentals and rental cars booked through Capital One Travel along with 2 miles per dollar on all other purchases will be a better fit for people who tend to spend a lot in areas that typically only earn 1 mile per dollar with other cards.
  • Bottom line: If you are a frequent traveler of Delta airlines, this card is a great option as you earn 2X miles on Delta purchases, at restaurants worldwide and at U.S. supermarkets.

Read our Delta SkyMiles Gold American Express Card review.

Best for business rewards with no annual fee: The Blue Business Plus Credit Card from American Express

  • Best features: For small business owners, this is one of the best credit cards with no annual fee, thanks to its solid rewards and flexible financing features. Cardholders earn 2X points per dollar on everyday business purchases, up to $50,000 per year; and 1X point thereafter.
  • Biggest drawbacks: The spending cap will disappoint businesses with large expenses over $50,000.
  • Alternative: If youre fine with redeeming your rewards for statement credits, the American Express Blue Business Cash Card is a better fit for small-business owners looking for a simple way to earn rewards. Learn more about the American Express Blue Business Plus vs. Blue Business Cash.
  • Bottom line: Frequent business travelers will appreciate the flexibility and features that come with The Blue Business Plus Credit Card from American Express.

Best for everyday travel: American Express Green Card

  • Best features: Its expanded travel category makes it a great fit for commuters who use public transportation and rideshare services frequently. Additionally, it earns high rates for certain dining purchases.
  • Biggest drawbacks: The American Express Green Card has a $150 annual fee that may be hard to offset if you dont fly frequently and use the CLEAR Plus and LoungeBuddy credits.
  • Alternatives: The Wells Fargo Autograph Card, which comes with no annual fee, may be a better option for frequent commuters since its extremely low-cost.
  • Bottom line: The Amex Green Card is a solid option if you fly and commute often, as long as you take advantage of the LoungeBuddy and CLEAR Plus membership credits and redeem points for travel.

What is an American Express credit card?

Seen as a gold standard in card services, American Express is both an issuer and a network. That means it issues cards and services them through its own network of merchants. American Express is known for excellent benefits, including no foreign transaction fees in the case of many cards and 2.7% in others (which is lower than many other cards).

But Amex is more than just a card issuer. In fact, it is tied with Chase for having the highest purchase volume of all credit card issuers in the U.S.

Services offered by American Express

  • Credit cards. Amex is perhaps best known for its luxury rewards credit cards, which offer premium benefits in exchange for a sometimes sizable annual fee. However, it does offer a few of the best cash back credit cards for everyday spending. With exclusive partnerships with Hilton and Delta, Amex also offers cards that reward mightily for loyalty.
  • Business cards. With a full suite of cards that cater to the business owner, Amex offers products that reward handsomely for business purchases.
  • Savings accounts. While not well known for this offering, Amexs savings accounts are worth a look with interest rates well above competitors.
  • Personal loans. For the qualifying member, you can get a personal loan with well under 10% APR.

How to choose an American Express credit card

American Express catalog of options provide a variety of ways to earn and reap benefits while using your card. With several strong rewards cards, there are specific spenders who best fit Amexs offers.

Who should get an Amex credit card

Travelers. When you want to earn hotel and airline points, American Express has some of the best travel rewards on the market. Amex travel cards offer lucrative rewards rates and high-end travel benefits. Guests frequenting Marriott, Hilton and Delta have lots of opportunity, plus, using American Express Travel to book trips with your card or redeem points for travel can come with bonus rewards and extra value.

Foodies. No matter where you get your meals, American Express has some of the best credit cards for food purchases. From the Blue Cash Preferred to the Gold and Platinum cards, cardmembers can find industry-leading rewards rates at U.S. supermarkets as well as top-notch rewards rates at restaurants.

Business owners. When you need a small-business credit card, Amex has you covered. Some come with no annual fee, while The Business Platinum Card carries a $695 annual price tag; some are built for simple cash back, others are for chasing travel points and loyalty status with airlines; some earn high-dollar welcome bonuses after spending a large amount, some are designed for a startup on a budget. No matter the case, your business could likely benefit from an Amex card.

Who should skip Amex credit cards?

Credit builders. If your credit history is less than stellar, its unlikely youll be approved for an American Express card. Amex cards come loaded with excellent member perks and typically require a FICO credit score in the range of 670 to 850. Those with credit scores outside this range would be better served by a card that allows them to build credit before moving up to an Amex.

Debt holders. Like some other financial institutions, Amex doesnt offer balance transfers on its credit cards. So if you carry a lot of debt on other credit cards, check out balance transfer credit cards. Making interest-free payments for a limited time could help you save a lot of money.

Overseas spenders. When you travel abroad or make online purchases with foreign merchants, its helpful to have a credit card that is widely accepted and charges no foreign transaction fees. American Express has a large presence around the world, but it doesnt match the global acceptance of Visa or Mastercard. Plus, most Amex credit cards charge a foreign transaction fee. (The ones that dont will come with an annual fee or are a Hilton or Delta co-branded credit card.)

What programs does American Express offer?

Many American Express credit cards feature competitive base rewards programs and lucrative welcome offers. They also offer a number of valuable benefits that can prove useful when shopping or traveling. These benefits, which are not exclusive to Amexs premium products, can include:

  • Extended warranty: When you make a purchase with your card, a one-year warranty is added to the original U.S. manufacturers warranty up to five years and for a maximum of $10,000. You cant exceed $50,000 in a calendar year.
  • Purchase protection: When you make a purchase on your card, your purchases can be protected up to 90 days if stolen or accidentally damaged. Its limited to $1,000 per item and $50,000 per cardmember per calendar year. With some premium cards, such as Platinum Card, the limit is $10,000 per item for up to $50,000 per calendar year.
  • Return protection: If a merchant wont take back an eligible item within 90 days, Amex might reimburse you for the full amount minus shipping and handling for up to $300 per item and up to $1,000 per calendar year.
  • Shop small: A way to support both small businesses and their cardholders, this program is offered by many Amex cards to give you a chance at earning a bit of cash back when spending at select local merchants.
  • Transfer partners: If you want to get the biggest bang for your buck, transferring your miles to one of the many American Express airline partners is usually your best bet. Compare American Express transfer partners with our full guide and valuations.
  • Baggage insurance plan: A travel and business card benefit, this plan varies according to the corresponding card and the state you are in.
  • Car rental loss and damage insurance: Unlike some of the best Chase credit cards, this insurance is secondary, meaning it kicks in after other insurance, such as your personal insurance.
  • Global Assist Hotline: Global Assist is available to all U.S. cardmembers and helps to prepare for your trip with customs information and destination guides. When you are more than 100 miles from home, benefits can include lost passport replacement assistance and translation services. There is also Premium Global Assist for superior products.
  • Statement credits:Depending on your card, you may have a few extra ways to save some money. The right Amex card will grant you statement credits to put towards travel purchases like Global Entry or TSA PreCheck and to help with paying for food through Uber Eats.
  • Travel insurance: This benefit varies by card. The most premium cards offer trip cancellation, interruption and delay insurance. Check out our guide to American Express travel insurance for card-by-card comparisons.
  • Lounge access: No matter what type of traveler you are, American Express has some of the best credit cards for airport lounge access. This includes the Green cards budget-friendly LoungeBuddy credit and the Platinum cards premium access to five lounge networks (good for more than 1,400 lounges in over 140 countries). For more information, take a look at this guide to American Express lounges.

American Express also offers several flexible payment options on certain personal and business cards. These options can include:

  • Pay It, Plan It: This feature, available on select personal cards, allows eligible cardholders to pay small purchase amounts (less than $100) right away through the American Express app. Alternatively, it lets them split up larger purchases (over $100) into monthly payments with a fixed fee. Learn if Amexs Pay It Plan It is worth it.
  • Pay Over Time: This feature, available on select personal and business cards, lets eligible cardholders carry a balance on eligible purchases, with interest.
  • Working Capital Terms: This feature allows eligible business cardholders to get access to up to $150,000 in funding.
  • Expanded Buying Power: This feature allows eligible business cardholders to spend over your credit limit (terms apply).

What is the American Express Membership Rewards program?

The Amex Membership Rewards program allows you to redeem your points in a variety of ways, whether you want to use it to give a gift or to save up for the big trip. Here are some of the ways you can redeem:

Redemption options

  • Travel Rewards:
    • Transfer Points. American Express transfer partners help you get the most mileage out of your Membership Rewards points. Though not all transfers are instantaneous, Amex has widespread connections with multiple travel partners and most of them transfer points at a 1:1 rate.
    • Book a trip with points on AmexTravel.com. You can use them for part or all of your flight, or a prepaid hotel, vacation package or cruise booking.
  • Gift Cards: You can redeem for gift cards to more than 100 restaurants, retailers, or for entertainment or travel brands. You can also redeem for an Amex gift card that you can use at participating retailers.
  • Merchandise: Shop on MembershipRewards.com for such items as electronics, jewelry, sports equipment or home decor.
  • Shopping: You can use points when shopping online and in-store with participating merchants.
  • Charges: You can apply points toward eligible charges youve already made on your card.
  • Charity: Use your points to make donations through the online social platform JustGiving.

How we picked the best American Express credit cards

Methodology: We analyzed American Express suite of cards to identify its top products in popular credit card categories. Core criteria we considered in our analysis include:

  • Base rewards program: Does the cards base rewards program offer a competitive return on spending for its card category (cash back, travel, business, etc.)?
  • Additional benefits: Does the card include applicable American Express services or benefits, like purchase protection, return protection, and an extended warranty for everyday spending cards, or baggage insurance, lounge access, or trip cancellation insurance for travel credit cards?
  • Welcome offer: Welcome offers let new cardholders earn extra rewards if they spend a certain amount of money in a specified time period, usually their first three months. Theyre a short-term incentive, but often quite lucrative, and can tip the scales when cards offer similar base rewards and benefits. As such, we factored welcome offers in our analysis of the best American Express cards.
  • Annual fee: Does the card carry an annual fee? Given many Amex cards do, we assessed whether that fee could be offset by the cards rewards program, welcome offer and any additional benefits. In other words, we considered the cards potential value.
  • Annual percentage rates (APR) and/or flexible financing options: Where applicable, are the cards APRs comparable to the average APR in its card category? Similarly, do cardholders have access to Amexs flexible financing features? Note: Its best practice to pay balances off in full on rewards credit cards so you dont lose points, miles or cashback to interest.

Frequently Asked Questions

American Express primarily offers rewards cards for personal or business use, so you generally need good-to-excellent credit to qualify for their products. That equates to a FICO credit score between 670 and 850.

Specific criteria will vary by product, and American Express considers other factors like your income or reported debt levels when considering your application. However, as a general rule of thumb, the more lucrative the rewards, the higher you can expect the credit score requirements to be. In other words, a score of 670 might qualify you for the entry-level Blue Cash Everyday Card, while the premium Platinum Card might require excellent credit (think a score of 740 or higher).

Learn more about American Express credit score requirements, plus get some tips on how to improve your credit.

American Express has a number of credit cards that charge no annual fee. These are all great options for people who dont want to pay every year for the privilege of enjoying a certain level of features and benefits. As long as your credit score meets Amexs good or excellent credit requirements, youll find cash back cards, travel rewards and even small business cards.

American Express credit cards that charge no annual fee include:

  • Blue Cash Everyday Card
  • Cash Magnet Card
  • Hilton Honors Card
  • Amex EveryDay Credit Card
  • Delta SkyMiles Blue American Express Card
  • Blue from American Express

American Express offers a number of features and benefits across all of their cards. From elevated earnings at restaurants and U.S. supermarkets, to generous travel perks and consumer protections, an Amex card brings incredible value to your wallet. Depending on the card, here is just a small sample of the American Express credit card benefits youre likely to find:

  • Welcome offers
  • Membership Rewards points
  • Cash back
  • Flexible payment options
  • Purchase and fraud protections
  • Access to special events like concerts, sports, and theater
  • Travel protections
  • Airline credits
  • Uber credit
  • Free first checked bag
  • Transferable points
  • No foreign transaction fee

American Express makes it easy to see if youre prequalified for any credit cards. Just fill out an online form, and Amex will perform a soft credit check that doesnt hurt your credit score. Most people will find out what cards they qualify for in less than a minute. If you qualify for any Amex credit cards, you may even receive personalized offers, such as a higher welcome bonus or lower interest rate. But prequalification doesnt mean youre approved. If you find an Amex offer you like, youll still need to apply, and when you do, Amex performs a hard credit check.
